docs.title: flet-rive
docs.text:
A cross-platform Flet extension for displaying Rive animations.

It is based on the rive Flutter package.

docs.title: Platform Support
docs.text:
This package supports the following platforms:

Platform Supported Windows ✅ macOS ✅ Linux ✅ iOS ✅ Android ✅ Web ✅

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
To install the flet-rive package and add it to your project dependencies:

uvpippoetry 
uv add flet-rive

pip install flet-rive  # (1)!
  1. After this, you will have to manually add this package to your requirements.txt or pyproject.toml.
poetry add flet-rive

docs.title: Added
docs.text:
• Rive control new properties: speed_multiplier, animations, state_machines, headers, clip_rect.
  • Deployed online documentation: https://flet-dev.github.io/flet-rive/

docs.title: Changed
docs.text:
• Refactored Rive control to use @ft.control dataclass-style definition.
  • Changed type annotation for fit from ImageFit to BoxFit.
Initial release.

docs.title: Example 1
docs.text:
example_1.py
import flet as ft

import flet_rive as ftr


def main(page: ft.Page):
    page.add(
        ftr.Rive(
            src="https://cdn.rive.app/animations/vehicles.riv",
            placeholder=ft.ProgressBar(),
            width=300,
            height=200,
        ),
        ftr.Rive(
            src="vehicles.riv",
            placeholder=ft.ProgressBar(),
            width=300,
            height=200,
        ),
    )


ft.run(main, assets_dir="assets")

The distance that the child's bottom edge is inset from the bottom of the stack.

Note

docs.title: clip_rect
docs.text:
clip_rect: Rect | None = None

Clip the artboard to this rect.

If not supplied it'll default to the constraint size provided by the parent control. Unless the Artboard has clipping disabled, then no clip will be applied.

docs.title: col
docs.text:
col: ResponsiveNumber = 12

If a parent of this control is a ResponsiveRow, this property is used to determine how many virtual columns of a screen this control will span.

Can be a number or a dictionary configured to have a different value for specific breakpoints, for example col={"sm": 6}.

This control spans the 12 virtual columns by default.

/// details | Dimensions type: info | Breakpoint | Dimension | |---|---| | xs | <576px | | sm | ≥576px | | md | ≥768px | | lg | ≥992px | | xl | ≥1200px | | xxl | ≥1400px | ///

docs.title: data
docs.text:
data: Any = skip_field()

Arbitrary data of any type.

docs.title: disabled
docs.text:
disabled: bool = False

Every control has disabled property which is False by default - control and all its children are enabled.

Note

The value of this property will be propagated down to all children controls recursively.

/// details | Example type: example For example, if you have a form with multiple entry controls you can disable them all together by disabling container:

ft.Column(
    disabled = True,
    controls=[
        ft.TextField(),
        ft.TextField()
    ]
)
///

enable_antialiasing: bool = True

Whether to enable anti-aliasing when rendering.

docs.title: expand
docs.text:
expand: bool | int | None = None

Specifies whether/how this control should expand to fill available space in its parent layout.

More information here.

Note

Has effect only if the direct parent of this control is one of the following controls, or their subclasses: Column, Row, View, Page.

docs.title: expand_loose
docs.text:
expand_loose: bool = False

Allows the control to expand along the main axis if space is available, but does not require it to fill all available space.

More information here.

Note

If expand_loose is True, it will have effect only if:

  • expand is not None and
  • the direct parent of this control is one of the following controls, or their subclasses: Column, Row, View, Page.

docs.title: offset
docs.text:
offset: OffsetValue | None = None

Applies a translation transformation before painting the control.

The translation is expressed as an Offset scaled to the control's size. So, Offset(x=0.25, y=0), for example, will result in a horizontal translation of one quarter the width of this control.

/// details | Example type: example The following example displays container at 0, 0 top left corner of a stack as transform applies -1 * 100, -1 * 100 (offset * control's size) horizontal and vertical translations to the control:

import flet as ft

def main(page: ft.Page):
    page.add(
        ft.Stack(
            width=1000,
            height=1000,
            controls=[
                ft.Container(
                    bgcolor="red",
                    width=100,
                    height=100,
                    left=100,
                    top=100,
                    offset=ft.Offset(-1, -1),
                )
            ],
        )
    )

ft.run(main)
///

docs.title: on_animation_end
docs.text:
on_animation_end: (
    ControlEventHandler[LayoutControl] | None
) = None

Called when animation completes.

Can be used to chain multiple animations.

The data property of the event handler argument contains the name of the animation.

More information here.

docs.title: opacity
docs.text:
opacity: Number = 1.0

Defines the transparency of the control.

Value ranges from 0.0 (completely transparent) to 1.0 (completely opaque without any transparency).

docs.title: page
docs.text:
page: Page | BasePage | None

The page to which this control belongs to.

docs.title: parent
docs.text:
parent: BaseControl | None

The direct ancestor(parent) of this control.

It defaults to None and will only have a value when this control is mounted (added to the page tree).

The Page control (which is the root of the tree) is an exception - it always has parent=None.

docs.title: placeholder
docs.text:
placeholder: Control | None = None

Control displayed while the Rive is loading.

docs.title: right
docs.text:
right: Number | None = None

The distance that the child's right edge is inset from the right of the stack.

Note

Effective only if this control is a descendant of one of the following: Stack control, Page.overlay list.

docs.title: rotate
docs.text:
rotate: RotateValue | None = None

Transforms this control using a rotation around its center.

The value of rotate property could be one of the following types:

  • number - a rotation in clockwise radians. Full circle 360° is math.pi * 2 radians, 90° is pi / 2, 45° is pi / 4, etc.
  • Rotate - allows to specify rotation angle as well as alignment - the location of rotation center.

/// details | Example type: example For example: 

ft.Image(
    src="https://picsum.photos/100/100",
    width=100,
    height=100,
    border_radius=5,
    rotate=Rotate(angle=0.25 * pi, alignment=ft.Alignment.CENTER_LEFT)
)
///

docs.title: rtl
docs.text:
rtl: bool = False

Whether the text direction of the control should be right-to-left (RTL).

docs.title: scale
docs.text:
scale: ScaleValue | None = None

Scales this control along the 2D plane. Default scale factor is 1.0, meaning no-scale.

Setting this property to 0.5, for example, makes this control twice smaller, while 2.0 makes it twice larger.

Different scale multipliers can be specified for x and y axis, by setting Control.scale property to an instance of Scale class. Either scale or scale_x and scale_y could be specified, but not all of them.

/// details | Example type: example 

ft.Image(
    src="https://picsum.photos/100/100",
    width=100,
    height=100,
    border_radius=5,
    scale=ft.Scale(scale_x=2, scale_y=0.5)
)
///

docs.title: speed_multiplier
docs.text:
speed_multiplier: Number = 1.0

A multiplier for controlling the speed of the Rive animation playback.

docs.title: src
docs.text:
src: str

The source of your rive animation.

Can either be a URL or a path to a local asset file.

docs.title: state_machines
docs.text:
state_machines: list[str] = field(default_factory=list)

List of state machines to play; none will play if empty.

docs.title: tooltip
docs.text:
tooltip: TooltipValue | None = None

The tooltip ot show when this control is hovered over.

docs.title: top
docs.text:
top: Number | None = None

The distance that the child's top edge is inset from the top of the stack.

Note

Effective only if this control is a descendant of one of the following: Stack control, Page.overlay list.

docs.title: use_artboard_size
docs.text:
use_artboard_size: bool = False

Determines whether to use the inherent size of the artboard, i.e. the absolute size defined by the artboard, or size the control based on the available constraints only (sized by parent).

docs.title: visible
docs.text:
visible: bool = True

Every control has visible property which is True by default - control is rendered on the page. Setting visible to False completely prevents control (and all its children if any) from rendering on a page canvas. Hidden controls cannot be focused or selected with a keyboard or mouse and they do not emit any events.

docs.title: width
docs.text:
width: Number | None = None

Imposed Control width in virtual pixels.
